We intercepted the vehicle M6 J14 to J15 and escorted them back clear their rubbish up.  Details passed to @EnvAgency. 5419 https://t.co/5tWwYYiaDZ
@StinkStopthe @maricaoneill @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @DaveJonesNuL @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency We are like rats in a lab, playing around with our health and our lives!

tweets.text: A few pictures of yesterday‚Äôs cleanup work at the wetland in #SilkstreamPark along the #SilkStream! If someone is missing half a skateboard, please let us know! We found it in the wetland! Let‚Äôs keep the Silkstream clean! @UnitasYZ #BurntOak #Barnet @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/l8NQVlF6K0

Can @ChichesterDC and @EnvAgencySE really GUARANTEE  that they will be able to technically &  financially defend Chichester‚Äôs coast  for the next 2-3 generations? If not, why are they expanding these coastal communities at the expense of their booming ecotourism economy? https://t.co/6kyujVKw4m

We‚Äôre looking forward to working closely with our partners to develop 25 innovative projects to respond to flooding across England.

The Flood and Coastal Resilience Innovation Programme will inform our approach to the climate crisis in the run-up to #COP26 and beyond. https://t.co/uLncFImWcY

entity.name: Good Morning Britain
entity.description: Good morning, Britain. Up early and need to catch up on the latest news, weather and sports? Then this weekday morning programme is for you, offering the latest information in such areas as entertainment, health and money. `Good Morning Britain' is the typical morning news and talk show. It features a number of presenters, correspondents and reporters covering what you should know to start your day before heading out the door.

tweets.text:
As part of #OpClampdown, our fisheries team have been patrolling the River Dee #Cheshire with @cheshirepolice to combat illegal #fishing during the course fish close season. 

If you see or suspect illegal fishing activity report it to our hotline on 0800 807060 https://t.co/KgQAYmtOKe

Hi @stwater. @RedIndustries2 have indicated that ground water is responsible for the extreme odour affecting the vast majority of NUL. Is this your domain? This has been getting progressively worse the last year. Are you at fault? @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA

We spent a long while working up the initial Keeping Ure Rivers Cool project with @yorkshire_dales @UniversityLeeds @WoodlandTrust @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE 
We love what has been achieved so far and hope we can continue this on into the future! 
#treeplanting #partnership https://t.co/WtLMpwMXGO

Example of WTT advice/project that can be supported by @EnvAgency  Fisheries Improvement Project funds, direct donations & @WildTroutTrust  Annual Auction in partnership with @DonCatchmentRT 
 https://t.co/f0EuYAEH0v via @DonCatchmentRT

After the modelling work with @YorkshireiCASP the monitoring with @SCORE_NSR @daleslandnet it‚Äôs so good to see @moorsforfuture undertaking the moorland works on this @bradfordmdc & @EnvAgencyYNE NFM project üëèüèº https://t.co/a1BHGuf0xt

3 of the 25 projects that have secured a share of ¬£150m funding to test new approaches to #flood risk management are in the #NorthWest! 

They include proactive property flood resilience, natural flood management & enhancing the resilience of our coasts

üëâhttps://t.co/my7LxnuXmK https://t.co/oh2QUE5QDX

@jamesrgrinter @EnvAgencySE James , the close season on the Lea applies upstream of Aquaduct Lock . You can fish below on the navigation all the way to Bow but not anywhere on the flood relief channel or old river . ¬†You are able to fish below Tottenham Lock . Hope this helps and tight lines !

Last week we had a fab days #treeplanting in #Bishopdale with our #volunteers, the 1st time they have been out in 2021. We planted parkland trees & finished planting up a steep gill. Both aimed at intercepting water. Thank you @h_r_marshall @WoodlandTrust for the #trees! #nfm https://t.co/ly2ifeqLsN

tweets.text:
Read @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA powerful blog from his #ABIConf21 speech 'Why the climate emergency threatens us all'
 
'The #ClimateEmergency is the unseen pandemic...left unchecked it will kill more people, & do much more harm, than Covid 19'

https://t.co/vMkwFzKQvR #EarthHour

The River Derwent floodplain today after 150-250 mm of rain across the fells. This part of the floodplain is downstream of Keswick and upstream of Bassenthwaite Lake. It provides some attenuation before the water heads down to Cockermouth. https://t.co/HKZgJ065tG

We are working with @EnvAgency  and  @FOIM_IlkleyMoor on a natural flood management  project to slow the flow of water from Ilkley Moor into Backstone Beck which flows into the River Wharfe. This work will also help peat bogs to form which store carbon.   https://t.co/Eh3svE5omT https://t.co/TtOAlMqpSr

Thames Water continues to state that it is addressing the problem but nothing happens. Climate change will likely increase rainfall and consequent flooding in the village. This is an unacceptable state of affairs.
@CMPG @HighwaysWMIDS @EnvAgency Doesn‚Äôt look like they were happy about it. Good. They should be made to spend a day clearing up other peoples crap. https://t.co/0mJBTpxNMw

@JamieMillarZZ Thanks for making us aware, Jamie. Could you please report the details of this incident to our emergency hotline so that our local specialist teams can investigate. The freephone number is 0800 807060 and they would appreciate any specific info and exact location details. Thanks.

Dirty water from our homes should go to a water treatment works not into our rivers or seas. Wrongly connected pipes cause pollution and harm wildlife. Make sure you @connectrightUK #NationalDrainageMisconnectionDay #BinIt4Beaches #RainDownTheDrain. https://t.co/PLaKsIqCVi
